alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 16 at 5:20PM CDT until March 16 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JOHNSON AND NORTHWESTERN ELLIS COUNTIES... At 520 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Keene, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Grand Prairie, Mansfield, Cedar Hill, Burleson, Cleburne, Midlothian, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Venus, Grandview, Maypearl, Cross Timber, Lake Pat Cleburne, Briaroaks, Coyote Flats, Sand Flat, Griffith, Egan and Lillian. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas. For your protection stay inside a sturdy structure and keep away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately.
